description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.

You will participate in all new project design reviews for data centers focusing specifically on the design performance at different stages of a design, as well as the portfolio of RFI’s and RFC’s. You will provide analytical feedback to the internal and external stakeholders on how to improve design performance in each design domain both on a project and portfolio level. Through effective monitoring of the performance of the internal design team and external vendors (Architectural Engineering firms), you will also drive closed loop lessons learned to continually improve. ject performance to minimize total costs of ownership as well as costs of poor quality deviations.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience managing problems, implementing and developing new processes and proactively manage cross-functional stakeholders to drive a decision or solution.
  • 5 years of experience in construction quality and commissioning (electrical/mechanical) equipment in a facility environment.
  • Experience implementing new product introductions through a progress product life cycle to mitigate risks and learn from field deployments.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • Professional Engineer (PE) license.
  • Experience with Revit, BIM 360, and 360 Field.
  • Experience in the bidding, designing, operating, and commissioning of electrical distribution system from high voltage (HV) transformer to branch circuits and/or industrial mechanical cooling systems.
responsibilities:
• Identify, qualify, recommend and provide management oversight and escalation for design performance of data center construction projects.
  • Collaborate with Engineering Design, Supply Chain, Construction and Operations teams to develop and refine data center design delivery and performance, specifications, processes, tools, and reporting metrics.
  • Assure closed loop learning for all site-level and portfolio level design performance and operational challenges throughout the data center lifecycle to update design requirements and documentation, product life cycle risk, quality criteria and construction project specifications and scripts as applicable.
  • Engage with cross functional teams from Design, Supply Chain, Construction and Operations to collectively manage, identify, evaluate and resolve project design-related challenges to converge on a scalable, global methodology.
title: Technical Program Manager, Data Center Quality, Design and Architectural Engineering
